meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Board (委員會), in relation to an appeal, means the Licensing Appeals Board as constituted to hear that appeal under section 125C of the Ordinance;
licensing authority (發牌當局) means the licensing authority who has made the decision appealed against;
notice of appeal (上訴通知書) means the notice of appeal referred to in section 3(1);
Vice-Chairman (副主席) means the person appointed as Vice-Chairman of the Licensing Appeals Board under section 125A(2)(b) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: How appeal is to be commenced

subsection.content: A person exercising a right of appeal under section 125(9) of the Ordinance shall commence the appeal by lodging with the secretary a notice of appeal in Form 1 in the Schedule setting out the grounds of appeal and shall attach to the notice of appeal copies of all documents, if any, on which he intends to rely in support of his appeal.

If a notice of appeal is lodged by a person who has no right of appeal, the secretary shall refer the notice to the Chairman and, if the Chairman directs that the notice is not to be accepted, inform the person accordingly.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Service of notice of appeal
section.content: The secretary shall, as soon as practicable after a notice of appeal is accepted under section 3, serve a copy of it and copies of any documents attached to it on the licensing authority.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Licensing authority to lodge statement and relevant documents
section.leadIn: The licensing authority shall, within 28 days after receiving a copy of the notice of appeal served under section 4 or such longer time as may be allowed by the Chairman, lodge with the secretary and serve on the appellant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: sets out its findings on material questions of fact;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: refers to the evidence or other material on which those findings were based;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: identifies all persons who made representations to the licensing authority regarding the matter in respect of which the decision appealed against was made;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: gives the reasons for that decision; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: states the policy, if any, based on which the licensing authority made that decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of any other document which is in the possession or under the control of the licensing authority and is considered by that authority to be relevant to the appeal.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Further document or material

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The Chairman, before the Board is constituted to hear the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Board, after it is constituted to hear the appeal, (E.R. 4 of 2020)

section.continued: may by notice in writing direct the appellant or the licensing authority to furnish to the Chairman or the Board, as the case may be, any document or material in the possession or under the control of that appellant or that licensing authority which is considered by the Chairman or the Board, as the case may be, to be relevant to the appeal.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Date, time and place of hearing

subsection.content: The secretary shall fix the date, time and place for hearing an appeal in consultation with the Chairman, or if the Vice-Chairman is to preside at the hearing, in consultation with the Vice-Chairman.
The secretary shall serve on the appellant and the licensing authority a notice of date, time and place for hearing in Form 2 in the Schedule at least 14 days before the date fixed for the hearing.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Making representations at hearing

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the written request of either party to an appeal, invite any person who may be affected by the decision of the Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on its own motion, invite any person identified under section 5(a)(iii),

section.continued: by serving on that person a notice in writing, to make representations at the hearing of the appeal.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Appearance before Board
section.content: The parties to an appeal may be present at the hearing of the appeal and make submission either in person or by an authorized representative.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Hearing to be in public except in special circumstances

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the hearing of an appeal shall be in public.

Where the Board after consulting the parties to the appeal is satisfied that it is desirable to do so, it may by order direct that the whole or part of the hearing shall take place in private and give directions as to the persons who may be present.
The hearing of an appeal may be conducted in Chinese or English or both as the Board thinks fit.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a party to an appeal or his authorized representative may address the Board in any language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person invited to make representations under section 8 may address the Board in any language;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a witness may give evidence before the Board in any language.

subsection.content: The appellant may abandon the appeal or any of the grounds of the appeal before the hearing of the appeal by notice in writing lodged with the secretary.
An appellant who lodges a notice under subsection (1) shall at the same time serve a copy of the notice on the licensing authority.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Absence from hearing
section.leadIn: If a party to an appeal fails to attend the hearing of the appeal either in person or by his authorized representative on the date and at the time fixed, the Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is satisfied that his failure to appear is due to reasonable cause, adjourn the hearing to a date and time as it thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to hear the appeal in his absence.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Decision of Board
section.content: The Board may order its decision to come into operation immediately or on a specified date.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Service
section.leadIn: Any document, notice or thing required to be served, lodged or furnished to any person under these Rules shall be duly served, lodged or furnished if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the secretary, the Chairman or the Board, it is left at or sent to the office of the secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person who is a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is sent by registered post addressed to the body at its registered office in Hong Kong or at any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is delivered to any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the body;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person who is not a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is sent by registered post addressed to the last known address of the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is delivered to the person personally.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.text:
PUBLIC HEALTH AND MUNICIPAL SERVICES ORDINANCE
(Chapter 132)(Section 3(1) of the Licensing Appeals Board Rules (Cap. 132 sub. leg.))NOTICE OF APPEAL

tr.td: Address of Appellant for service of documents (if different from the above):
(attach a copy of the decision issued by the licensing authority and indicate the particular aspect(s) being the subject of the appeal)
The grounds for this appeal are: (set them out in full)
You are required to attach to this notice copies of all documents, if any, on which you intend to rely in support of your appeal.

crossHeading.inline:
Form 2PUBLIC HEALTH AND MUNICIPAL SERVICES ORDINANCE
(Chapter 132)

schedule.text:
(Section 7 of the Licensing Appeals Board Rules (Cap. 132 sub. leg.))NOTICE OF DATE, TIME AND PLACE FIXED
FOR HEARING OF AN APPEAL
In the matter of the Appeal lodged by .(Appellant) against the decision of . under . on the . day of .
TAKE NOTICE that the above appeal will be heard at .. on the . day of . 20. at . a.m. / p.m.

TAKE NOTICE that if you do not attend at the date and time mentioned, either in person or by a person duly authorized to appear on your behalf, the appeal may be adjourned for reasonable cause or may be heard in your absence.

Dated this . day of . 20.
Secretary, Licensing Appeals Board
